intro: Dichromena capillaris, commonly known as the slender dichromena, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its delicate, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, two-lipped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
